name: Rite of the Storm
author: Shane , Avaro
urls: zc_quests/623/Rite of the Storm/Rite of the Storm.qst
informationHtml: Rite of the Storm is a miniquest made for the Random Theme Contest hosted by Jamian. It was built in roughly two weeks with a lot of Metroidvania elements in mind.
descriptionHtml:
Note: Be sure to put the Rite of the Storm music within your ZC folder along with the quest!

Rite of the Storm is a miniquest made for the Random Theme Contest hosted by Jamian. It was built in roughly two weeks with a lot of Metroidvania elements in mind. Since then we have listened to community feedback and made a more definitive version of the quest! Here's a list of the changes:
  • Majority of the dialogue has been rewritten by Aevin.
  • Added a credits sequence.
  • Save point can now be activated with the A button. A visual cue will give you indication of such.
  • A few hints have been edited to be less vague.
  • A few shortcuts have been added across the quest.
  • A room in the second area has been edited to be much more tolerable.
  • Some enemies have been nerfed, somewhat.
  • Few puzzles have been altered.
  • And some general bug fixes.
Minor and potential final update as of 16th of July 2018. List of changes and additions:
  • Gale and Caelum's graphics have been improved.
  • Some of the graphics have been improved and changed.
  • A visual hint has been added to help solve the maze puzzle.
  • Some general bug fixes.
storyHtml: A supernatural storm has plagued the world with death and destruction and there has been no light for decades. A young boy named Gale decides to investigate a labyrinth rumored to have connections with this storm in the hopes to find answers and perhaps a way to end the storm. Will he succeed?
tipsAndCheatsHtml:
• To set a continue point, walk over the save tiles.
  • Using the built-in ZC map only shows the area you are in. Use it often if you're stuck!
  • The password for the quest will be provided at the end.
creditsHtml:
All credits are in the quest's credit sequence but I would like to give a few shout-outs:
  • Jamian for hosting the contest. Without it this quest never would of happened!
  • Aevin for being so generous and helping improve the dialogue in this quest. His quests also served as a huge source of inspiration!
  • Ambient Silence for all the support and feedback.

name: Herald of Heroes
author: TheRock , MischeviousMalfais
informationHtml: Herald of Heroes is a story-based, dungeon-romping quest. It takes place 100 years after the Hero of Time and Princess Zelda were defeated by pig Ganon. It features amazing dungeons by TheRock, and story by CMC2000.
descriptionHtml:
Update: 2-27-18: Fixed a bug in Dank Cellar where you could get stuck
Update: 3-2-18: Fixed a problem with the Dragon's Cave Boss
Update: 10-27-21: Added two screens in the Desert left and right of the dungeon there, fixed a bug in Palace of Mystery, fixed a map for Dragons Cave so it says you get a Heart Container on that screen, and mad so the player can't go out of bounds with a water screen abuse.

Herald of Heroes is a story-based, challenge-packed collaboration adventure made by CMC2000 and TheRock. Taking place approximately 100 years after the hero of time and princess Zelda were defeated by pig Ganon, it features 3 difficulty settings (for those who don’t want a game that’s too hard/easy), a boatload of mind-challenging dungeons (to make sure it’s not too easy anyway), custom bosses, and an engaging storyline. Collaboration means that you get the best of dungeon design from TheRock, and the best of story from CMC2000. We hope you enjoy this gift from us—The Legend of Zelda, Herald of Heroes! We had a lot of fun making it!

The game includes:

Individually themed dungeons that help the game come to life

Around 10+ hours of gameplay

Three difficulty settings to choose from: Easy, Normal, and insane. This difficulty can be lowered at almost any time after the first dungeon, but cannot be raised once you’ve lowered it.

Multiple, varied Overworlds

A wide variety of Challenge rooms that test your reflexes as well as your brain

Custom Boss fights (without fancy scripts!)

Unique, satisfying puzzles all throughout the game
storyHtml:
Long ago, the great king Ganon liberated the people of Hyrule from the selfish reign of Hylian monarchy, and with all three pieces of Triforce in his possession he became the greatest king ever to rule the land. Now, nearly a century later, he has brought his kingdom through many difficulties and trials. But after all these troubles, the land is finally in a state of peace.

However, there have been rumors of one small, final rebellion led by a remnant of the Hylian royal family, which still stands against Ganon’s rule.

What will this do to affect the peace of Ganon’s kingdom?
tipsAndCheatsHtml:
Symbol meanings on overworld map:
Black dot = Memory stone
White dot = Heart piece
White X = Underground heart piece

Use Ex1 and Ex2 for changing the B item fast.

Spacebar is disabled everywhere. This is because we wanted to make everything consistent on the overworld and in dungeons.

Your amount of rupees you can carry is unlimited, unless you try to get more than 9999 rupees.

All heart containers are found within the main dungeons (Except the last) and are marked on the mini map.

All boss cutscenes are a one-time watch.

Georgie (the bird) can grab all items.
creditsHtml:
Special thanks to nainiëOlive for making some amazing music for this game!

You can find some of her other music here: https://soundcloud.com/user-365827890

The full credits are included at the end of the game.

name: ZScript Havoc
author: Avaro
informationHtml: Dungeons, puzzles, scripts and chaos.
descriptionHtml:
Epilepsy warning!

Enhanced music is included in the download. Keep it in the same folder as the questfile for it to work.

Yes, go ahead and play it! The quest is great, you have my guarantee. And yep, this is kind of a joke quest.

The rest of this description is more about me, than about the quest. I made this quest because I felt it. My goal was to create an overall good quest and fill it with crazy scripts because I enjoy it. It took me about 6 months, excluding the longer breaks. I actually wanted to finish this quest much quicker, but it is how it is. I hope you like this quest as much as I do!
storyHtml: ZScript Havoc.
tipsAndCheatsHtml: You will get hit a lot. Don't take the combat too seriously, it'll be fine. Use F6 -> Continue to refill your health whenever you need to.

name: Language. Sex. Violence. Other? (Exate Edition)
author: Taco Chopper
informationHtml: GB-style dungeon romper from 2009 finally finds its way to the PureZC database in 2022!
descriptionHtml:
Please note: this is being uploaded to PureZC for archival purposes only.

"Language. Sex. Violence. Other?", or LSVO as it became to be known, was originally released in late 2009. Because PureZC would only accept 2.10 quests at the time, it was hosted on an alternative quest database in zcrealm, a site which has since long vanished from the internet. A few months ago, I was looking for this quest as reference material for Three Crests, only to realise that I no longer had it. I'd thought I lost the quest for good - I made this quest on my parents' computer at the time, which I assume is long gone in the 13 or so years since then. Through the help of the Wayback Machine, I was able to recover a version of it.

However, the original version is significantly outdated. Upon release, the quest was buggy, rough and needed a lot of work. There's sequence breaking, along with many potential soft-locks. I'd taken a break from PureZC almost immediately after release (the forum thread at the time cites a broken computer for the reason?), and Exate took on the role of principal debugger and cleaner of all things broken. That version, which I'm labelling as the Exate Edition, is the superior of the two for obvious reasons. It wasn't hosted on zcrealm, but the also now-defunct Exalted Legion instead.

More recently, Deathrider365 messaged the PureZC Discord asking about the quest's existence for a commenter on their LPs. Upon a quick search on the forums I realised that not only had Exate posted a mediafire link to his version of the quest, but that the link still worked!

So for archival purposes, I present Language. Sex. Violence. Other?, the Exate Edition. It's a sprawling mess of a quest, but a glorious one at that.
storyHtml:
From the 2009 release on zcrealm:

This was started sometime between August and September 2008, after the somewhat failure of "Legend of Koop", which only had up to Level 5 completed. Time passed, and now here is, almost a year and a half later. 10 dungeons, two full overworlds, and unlike my last major quest, Protector of the Damn Universe, hardly any dialogue. There's no real plot until after Level 3; I couldn't be bothered setting up some fancy story about the Ruler of Hyrule, and how he gave his noble servant a bucket of buffalo wings.
Note: There is low amounts of coarse language in the quest. You have been advised.
So, yeah. Have a play with it. If you enjoy it, let me know.
tipsAndCheatsHtml:
A warning: this quest gets absurdly hard. Eppy37 has a Let's Play from around the time of the quest's release, which makes for essential viewing regarding the difficulty curve - I have also linked the Let's Play above. The later stages of the quest appear to really ramp up in difficulty - the Blue Ring is found in Level 8, and upon looking at it for the first time in over a decade, Level 7 looks like an absolute nightmare without it.

Once more, I've uploaded this quest for archival purposes only.

I can't stress this enough - I will NOT be able to edit anything in the quest. Bugs, glitches, game balance or cheats are all untouchable. It's been thirteen years and I have no idea what the quest password might be. I may not be totally able to provide concrete answers for questions like "where is the sword" or "where is the next dungeon" either - it's a giant, sprawling quest with little guidance for the player on what or where they should head next. Again, Eppy's LP may be a worthwhile reference if you're stuck on a particular section of the quest.

I assume this quest is playable in 2.53 and beyond - in 2.55 a101, I got as far as the fifth dungeon in the original quest file that I recovered from the archived zcrealm release.
creditsHtml:
Credits for the Exate Edition:
Deathrider365 for reaching out on Discord about this quest's existence. Without an insistent commenter on their video this quest wouldn't be on the database right now.
Exate for debugging, significant quality control, subscreen edits, as well as having uploaded the quest to a filesharing service in 2013 - without that stroke of luck, this quest would definitely not be on the database at all.
Adailton Cabeludo on YouTube - without your insistence, this quest would have been lost to time
Eppy37 - Let's Play footage for the quest database submission

Original credits from the 2009 release on zcrealm:
Akkabus/Glenn The Great - EZGBZ Tileset
Lithium/Aslion - Shieldless Link tiles, beta testing, advice n' etc
jimmyb - Elvis sprites
Rambly - Beta testing, support
Exate, Evile - support and advice
Ironfist - Being annoying in general. Keep it up!
